definition: prophet
to advance/in advance/beforehand/to prepare
words/speech/to say/to talk

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.chinese: 約翰可算是個倒運的預言家。

sentences.english: The prophets of doom back up their figures with tales of woe.
sentences.chinese: 悲觀的預言家用悲觀的故事支持他們的數據。

sentences.english: Michel de Nostredame (aka Nostradamus) was a 16th-century French "seer."
sentences.chinese: 諾查丹瑪斯是十六世紀法國的大預言家。

sentences.english: Interesting is how the doomsayers' predictions never seem to come true.
sentences.chinese: 有趣的是，末日預言家們的預言似乎從來沒有正確過。

sentences.english: Don't predict the future, create it!
sentences.chinese: 企業家不要扮成預言家裝神弄鬼。

sentences.english: The execrations of the prophet terrified the sinful multitude .
sentences.chinese: 那個預言家的咒詛嚇壞了充滿罪惡的羣衆。

sentences.english: Now this Centaur was a prophet as a good many Centaurs are.
sentences.chinese: 卻說這怪物是個預言家，就像許多優秀的人馬那樣。

sentences.english: I bear witness that President Kimball is a prophet.
sentences.chinese: 我向你作證金博爾總統是一個預言家。

sentences.english: Monnet was that rarest of all prophets who put people at ease .
sentences.chinese: 在讓人民放心的預言家中，莫內特是最少見的。

sentences.english: People have always paid honor to historians, but ignored prophets.
sentences.chinese: 人們總是禮敬歷史學家，冷落預言家。

sentences.english: We don't have many seers these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今我們的社會卻沒有那麼多的預言家。

definition: rank/level
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
Homo economicus
physical chemistry
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
barbarian
eyewitness (to an incident)/witness (to a legal transaction)
a spy/a crafty person
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
to stake all on one throw
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
missionary/preacher
